content: As you can see on the next bar, the negative $7.5 million contribution demonstrate what Andrew was speaking about and Pete, Redwire continues to make investments in business development, R&D and public company costs that helped expand the size of the contract opportunities and â but it impacted our first half of 2022 EBITDA, especially the first quarter of 2022. as one, we expect revenue to come in, in the first quarter that was delayed and now will come in, in the second half of 2022, and two, we are purposely investing in Redwire to achieve scale, operating leverage and profitable growth, with much of the incremental SG&A costs foundational in this unique and growing space company. We assess our 2022 adjusted EBITDA guidance on: one, the analysis concerning revenue guidance already spoke about; and two, our contract mix especially any accretion dilution to actual and forecast gross margins; and three, finally, the investments we made in operating expenses and those trends quarter-over-quarter and what we believe we can achieve in the second half.
